import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import '@salesforce-ux/design-system/assets/styles/salesforce-lightning-design-system.min.css'; const Tasks = () => { // Sample data to simulate fetching from an API const [tasks, setTasks] = useState([ { id: 1, assignedTo: 'User 1', status: 'Completed', dueDate: '12/10/2024', priority: 'Low', comments: 'This task is good' }, { id: 2, assignedTo: 'User 2', status: 'In Progress', dueDate: '14/09/2024', priority: 'High', comments: 'This' }, { id: 3, assignedTo: 'User 3', status: 'Not Started', dueDate: '18/08/2024', priority: 'Low', comments: 'This' }, { id: 4, assignedTo: 'User 4', status: 'In Progress', dueDate: '12/06/2024', priority: 'Normal', comments: 'This task is good' } ]); return (
{tasks.map((task) => ( ))}
Assigned To
Status

Comments
Actions
{task.assignedTo} {task.status} {task.dueDate} {task.priority} {task.comments}
); }; export default Tasks;
